ratings.comment: My favorite professor. Couldn't understand a word he said but as long as you followed along on the chalkboard you could multitask with Netflix. Be prepared for a 5 min drawn out joke at the beginning at the lecture.

I was worried because of rate my professor .com 2.0 rating but I took his course. All his exams are straight from homeworks. Memorising entire homework problems already guarantees A from three major exams. It is true that lectures are puzzling, but discussion sections help a lot. Very flexible exam policy is impressive. He was more than i expected.
Prof Jin's English can be incredibly difficult to understand at times, but his point is usually understandable.

Sent him an email one time asking something specific that there was confusion about throughout my whole section. Got a short, rude email back. He cracks jokes during lecture that make calculus 2 slightly more bearable but he expects students to have an extremely solid basis of calculus making the class hard if you scraped through Calc 221.
Thought he was a great professor all around. While he was hard to understand at times, EVERY single test question is straight from the book. If you do practice problems, you are fine.

He sometimes starts lectures off with a really good joke that almost makes it worth going to. You don't learn much in lecture that you won't learn in discussion. It can be hard to understand him sometimes & he often makes mistakes. Overall the class isn't too difficult, as there is no trig. Although you better know everything about the letter "e".

Horrible professor. He makes so many mistakes during lecture. He just regurgitates the book, and makes lectures useless. He made one of the exams so hard, when going over it in lecture he didn't even know how to do it. He began handing out extra credit like it was candy to those who could help him solve the exam. Complete joke, avoid him entirely.

I have him for calc 211, and I've never had a professor make so many mistakes while teaching. The tests are far beyond anything we touch in lecture, and the homework assigned does little to no good because the fundamental base of each topic is rarely solidified in lecture. Hard to hear. Deathly long lectures. Sometimes tries to tell jokes??

He made so many mistakes it was almost unbelievable. I was convinced at least half the class new the material better than him. He taught straight from the textbook, so I benefited from skipping classes and teaching myself from the book (even though the book is really bad, too.) Homework was reasonable and the exams were easy. But still, avoid him.
Most confusing Professor I have dealt with. Poor grading. No idea what he is doing

The worst professor I have had. The entire class is him summarizing chapters in the book and him doing the examples incorrectly on the board - so if  none of the students who are learning the material catches his mistakes, everyone ends up writing and learning incorrect solutions. Changed grading from 100% HW to 60% exams halfway through semester
Doing the homework problems really helps with understanding the concepts.  He has a farely easy grading scale.  So overall he is not too bad.

He speaks very quietly, and even if he spoke loud enough he would be unintelligible because of his poor English. He seems genuinely angry when we don't understand things. If you take Jin for a class, you're on your own.
teaches in an extremely cool way - gives 6 challenging homework assignments and no exams. Awesome teacher too, his lectures are super interesting.
